body: It seems to work consistently as long as you don't select the "Default" IDE check style.
I can confirm that it does not work.

Works like a charm on:

```
IntelliJ IDEA 2017.3.2 (Community Edition)
Build #IC-173.4127.17, built on December 19, 2017
JRE: 1.8.0_152-release-1024-b8 amd64
JVM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
Windows 10 10.0
```

Can confirm works perfectly on 
```
IntelliJ IDEA 2017.3.3 (Ultimate Edition)
Build #IU-173.4301.25, built on January 16, 2018
JRE: 1.8.0_152-release-1024-b11 x86_64
JVM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
Mac OS X 10.13.2
```

I'm having a problem with imports that might be related. When I format a java source file in IntelliJ with the google-java-format plugin enabled, imports that start with `java.` are kept in a separate list of imports (separated by whitespace that is) from all of the other imports, but this violates the Google Style guide. When I use the google-java-format jar to format the same file, it keeps these imports in the same list as all the other imports

Doesn't work for me either. 

Should the built in "Code Style" settings be completely overridden by this plugin? It seems like whatever I pick there is used instead of the `google-java-format` which is enabled for the project.

```
IntelliJ IDEA 2017.3.4 (Community Edition)
Build #IC-173.4548.28, built on January 30, 2018
JRE: 1.8.0_152-release-1024-b11 x86_64
JVM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
Mac OS X 10.11.6
```

Think I have solved with these steps:
* Enable the formatter plugin
* Copy "Default" scheme into project
* Go into "Imports" scroll down to "Import layout", and remove the "java" settings in the table

issue.title: Different results from different tools using same style guide

repository.name: fmt-maven-plugin
repository.description: Opinionated Maven Plugin that formats your Java code.

issue.body: The code format results from the Intellij plugin https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/8527-google-java-format is different from the results of this maven plugin.

body:
@aaime I had to add an additional step:

1. Enable the formatter plugin
2. Copy "Default" scheme into project
3. Go into "Imports" 
4. Set "Class count to use import with '*'" and "Name count to use static import with '*'" to 999
5. scroll down to "Import layout", set it to:
- Import static all other imports
- Blank line
- import all other imports

I feel that the imports were automatically correct in past versions of IntelliJ and the plugin...

issue.title: [I] Add needed codestyle settings

repository.name: saros
repository.description: Open Source IDE plugin for distributed collaborative software development

issue.body:
Adds some basic codestyle settings for Intellij which are still needed
with the google java style plugin.

Adds import settings to match the google java style:
 - Don't use wildcards for normal imports.
 - Don't use wildcards for static imports.
 - Order imports correctly.
Setting this manually in the Intellij settings is currently needed as
imports are not correctly handled by the google java style plugin.
For more details, see the following issues.
 - google/google-java-format#94
 - google/google-java-format#236
The used formatting rules were suggested in 263.

Sets the right margin to 100 characters so that it is displayed
correctly in the editor.

Sets indentation and tab size to two spaces as well as the
continuation indentation size to 4 spaces to match the google style.
Otherwise, the Intellij format analyzer complains that the used
indentation size does not match the settings.

body:
Note that this is still occurring for me exactly as described above with plugin version 1.16.0.2 . it seems like the import settings aren't being respected at all; for example see screenshot of configured settings vs end result when imports are optimized, where the java.* packages are separated. tried steps above as well which did not change anything.  note that when running the jar directly on this file the output is correct

any ideas what could be going on please? thanks!
